verses.verse: And it came to pass<WH1732>, when David and his men<WH582> were come<WH935> to Ziklag<WH6860> on the third<WH7992> day<WH3117>, that the Amalekites<WH6003> had made a raid<WH6584> upon the South<WH5045>, and upon Ziklag<WH6860>, and had smitten<WH5221> Ziklag<WH6860>, and burned<WH8313> it with fire<WH784>,

and had taken captive<WH7617> the women<WH802> and all that were therein<WH6996>, both small and great<WH1419>: they slew<WH4191> not any<WH376>, but carried them off<WH5090>, and went<WH3212> their way<WH1870>.

And when David<WH1732> and his men<WH582> came<WH935> to the city<WH5892>, behold<WH8313>, it was burned with fire<WH784>; and their wives<WH802>, and their sons<WH1121>, and their daughters<WH1323>, were taken captive<WH7617>.
Then David<WH1732> and the people<WH5971> that were with him lifted up<WH5375> their voice<WH6963> and wept<WH1058>, until they had no more power<WH3581> to weep<WH1058>.
And David<WH1732>'s two<WH8147> wives<WH802> were taken captive<WH7617>, Ahinoam<WH293> the Jezreelitess<WH3159>, and Abigail<WH26> the wife<WH802> of Nabal<WH5037> the Carmelite<WH3761>.

And David<WH1732> was greatly<WH3966> distressed<WH3334>; for the people<WH5971> spake<WH559> of stoning<WH5619> him<WH5315>, because the soul of all the people<WH5971> was grieved<WH4843>, every man<WH376> for his sons<WH1121> and for his daughters<WH1323>: but David<WH1732> strengthened<WH2388> himself in Jehovah<WH3068> his God<WH430>.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Abiathar<WH54> the priest<WH3548>, the son<WH1121> of Ahimelech<WH288>, I pray thee<WH5066>, bring me hither the ephod<WH646>. And Abiathar<WH54> brought<WH5066> thither the ephod<WH646> to David<WH1732>.

And David<WH1732> inquired<WH7592> of Jehovah<WH3068>, saying<WH559>, If I pursue<WH7291> after<WH310> this troop<WH1416>, shall I overtake<WH5381> them<WH559>? And he answered him<WH7291>, Pursue; for thou shalt surely<WH5381> overtake<WH5381> them<WH5337>, and shalt without fail recover all<WH5337>.

So David<WH1732> went<WH3212>, he and the six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> that were with him<WH935>, and came to the brook<WH5158> Besor<WH1308>, where those that were left behind<WH3498> stayed<WH5975>.

But David<WH1732> pursued<WH7291>, he and four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376>; for two hundred<WH3967> stayed behind<WH5975>, who were so faint<WH6296> that they could not go over<WH5674> the brook<WH5158> Besor<WH1308>.

And they found<WH4672> an Egyptian<WH376> in the field<WH7704>, and brought<WH3947> him to David<WH1732>, and gave<WH5414> him bread<WH3899>, and he did eat<WH398>; and they gave him water<WH4325> to drink<WH8248>.

And they gave<WH5414> him a piece<WH6400> of a cake<WH1690> of figs<WH8147>, and two clusters of raisins<WH6778>: and when he had eaten<WH398>, his spirit<WH7307> came again<WH7725> to him<WH398>; for he had eaten no bread<WH3899>, nor drunk<WH8354> any water<WH4325>, three<WH7969> days<WH3117> and three<WH7969> nights<WH3915>.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> unto him<WH559>, To whom belongest thou? and whence art thou? And he said, I am a young man<WH5288> of Egypt<WH4713>, servant<WH5650> to an Amalekite<WH376>; and my master<WH113> left<WH5800> me<WH7969>, because three days<WH3117> ago I fell sick<WH2470>.

We made a raid<WH6584> upon the South<WH5045> of the Cherethites<WH3774>, and upon that which belongeth to Judah<WH3063>, and upon the South<WH5045> of Caleb<WH3612>; and we burned<WH8313> Ziklag<WH6860> with fire<WH784>.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to him<WH3381>, Wilt thou bring me down to this troop<WH1416>? And he said<WH559>, Swear<WH7650> unto me by God<WH430>, that thou wilt neither kill<WH4191> me<WH518>, nor deliver<WH5462> me up into the hands<WH3027> of my master<WH113>, and I will bring thee down<WH3381> to this troop<WH1416>.

And when he had brought him down<WH3381>, behold<WH5203>, they were spread abroad over all<WH6440> the ground<WH776>, eating<WH398> and drinking<WH8354>, and dancing<WH2287>, because of all the great<WH1419> spoil<WH7998> that they had taken<WH3947> out of the land<WH776> of the Philistines<WH6430>, and out of the land<WH776> of Judah<WH3063>.

And David<WH1732> smote<WH5221> them from the twilight<WH5399> even unto the evening<WH6153> of the next day<WH4283>: and there escaped<WH4422> not a man<WH376> of them<WH702>, save four hundred<WH3967> young<WH5288> men<WH376>, who rode<WH7392> upon camels<WH1581> and fled<WH5127>.
And David<WH1732> recovered<WH5337> all that the Amalekites<WH6002> had taken<WH3947>; and David<WH1732> rescued<WH5337> his two<WH8147> wives<WH802>.

And there was nothing lacking<WH5737> to them<WH4480>, neither small<WH6996> nor great<WH1419>, neither sons<WH1121> nor daughters<WH1323>, neither spoil<WH7998>, nor anything that they had taken<WH3947> to them<WH1732>: David brought back all<WH3947>.

And David<WH1732> took<WH3947> all the flocks<WH6629> and the herds<WH1241>, which they drove<WH5090> before<WH6440> those<WH1931> other cattle<WH4735>, and said<WH559>, This is David<WH1732>'s spoil<WH7998>.

And David<WH1732> came<WH935> to the two hundred<WH3967> men<WH582>, who were so faint<WH6296> that they could not follow<WH3212> David<WH1732>, whom also they had made to abide<WH3427> at the brook<WH5158> Besor<WH1308>; and they went forth<WH3318> to meet<WH7125> David<WH1732>, and to meet<WH7125> the people<WH5971> that were with him<WH1732>: and when David came near<WH5066> to the people<WH5971>, he saluted them<WH7592>.

Then answered<WH6030> all the wicked<WH7451> men<WH376> and base<WH1100> fellows<WH582>, of those that went<WH1980> with David<WH1732>, and said<WH559>, Because they went<WH1980> not with us<WH5414>, we will not give them aught of the spoil<WH7998> that we have recovered<WH5337>, save to every man<WH376> his wife<WH802> and his children<WH1121>, that he may lead them away<WH5090>, and depart<WH3212>.

Then said<WH559> David<WH1732>, Ye shall not do so<WH6213>, my brethren<WH251>, with that which Jehovah<WH3068> hath given<WH5414> unto us<WH8104>, who hath preserved us<WH5414>, and delivered the troop<WH1416> that came<WH935> against us into our hand<WH3027>.

And who will hearken<WH8085> unto you in this matter<WH1697>? for as his share<WH2506> is that goeth down<WH3381> to the battle<WH4421>, so shall his share<WH2506> be that tarrieth<WH3427> by the baggage<WH3627>: they shall share<WH2505> alike<WH3162>.
And it was so from that day<WH3117> forward<WH4605>, that he made<WH7760> it a statute<WH2706> and an ordinance<WH4941> for Israel<WH3478> unto this day<WH3117>.

And when David<WH1732> came<WH935> to Ziklag<WH6860>, he sent<WH7971> of the spoil<WH7998> unto the elders<WH2205> of Judah<WH3063>, even to his friends<WH7453>, saying<WH559>, Behold<WH1293>, a present for you of the spoil<WH7998> of the enemies<WH341> of Jehovah<WH3068>:
To them<WH834> that were in Beth-el<WH1008>, and to them that were in Ramoth<WH7418> of the South<WH5045>, and to them that were in Jattir<WH3492>,
and to them that were in Aroer<WH6177>, and to them that were in Siphmoth<WH8224>, and to them that were in Eshtemoa<WH851>,
and to them that were in Racal<WH7403>, and to them that were in the cities<WH5892> of the Jerahmeelites<WH3397>, and to them that were in the cities<WH5892> of the Kenites<WH7017>,
and to them that were in Hormah<WH2767>, and to them that were in Bor-ashan<WH3565>, and to them that were in Athach<WH6269>,
and to them that were in Hebron<WH2275>, and to all the places<WH4725> where David<WH1732> himself and his men<WH582> were wont to haunt<WH1980>.
